apps_logging_app.producers.kafka_handler package¶

Submodules¶

apps_logging_app.producers.kafka_handler.config module¶

class apps_logging_app.producers.kafka_handler.config.KafkaHandlerConfig(*, type, name, topics=None, max_retries=5, brokers, security_protocol='SSL', ssl_cafile, ssl_certfile, ssl_keyfile, ssl_password, acks='all', retries=3, batch_size=16384, linger_ms=5, buffer_memory=33554432)[source]

Bases: BaseProducerConfig

Configuration model for a Kafka producer with SSL/SASL and performance settings.

This class defines all necessary parameters to configure a Kafka producer, including broker addresses, security protocols, SSL credentials, acknowledgment settings, retries, batching, and memory buffers. Validation is enforced using Pydantic field validators to ensure data integrity.

Parameters:

  • type (str)

  • name (str)

  • topics (List[str])

  • max_retries (int)

  • brokers (List[str])

  • security_protocol (str)

  • ssl_cafile (str)

  • ssl_certfile (str)

  • ssl_keyfile (str)

  • ssl_password (str)

  • acks (str)

  • retries (int)

  • batch_size (int)

  • linger_ms (int)

  • buffer_memory (int)

brokers

List of Kafka broker addresses. Must be a non-empty list of non-empty strings.

Type:

List[str]

security_protocol

Security protocol for the Kafka connection. Must be one of “SSL”, “PLAINTEXT”, “SASL_SSL”, or “SASL_PLAINTEXT”. Defaults to “SSL”.

Type:

str

ssl_cafile

Path to the CA certificate file for SSL connections.

Type:

str

ssl_certfile

Path to the client certificate file for SSL connections.

Type:

str

ssl_keyfile

Path to the client key file for SSL connections.

Type:

str

ssl_password

Password for the SSL key file.

Type:

str

acks

Kafka acknowledgment mode. Must be “all”, “0”, or “1”. Defaults to “all”.

Type:

str

retries

Number of times the producer will retry sending messages on failure. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 3.

Type:

int

batch_size

Maximum size (in bytes) of a batch of messages. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 16384.

Type:

int

linger_ms

Time in milliseconds to wait before sending a batch. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 5.

Type:

int

buffer_memory

Total memory (in bytes) available to the producer for buffering. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 33554432.

Type:

int

brokers: List[str]
security_protocol: str
ssl_cafile: str
ssl_certfile: str
ssl_keyfile: str
ssl_password: str
acks: str
retries: int
batch_size: int
linger_ms: int
buffer_memory: int
classmethod validate_brokers(v)[source]

Validates the brokers field to ensure it is a non-empty list of strings.

This validator checks that:

  1. brokers is a list.

  2. The list is not empty.

  3. Each broker in the list is a non-empty string.

Parameters:

  • cls – The class being validated.

  • v (Any) – The value of the brokers field.

Returns:

The validated list of broker addresses.

Return type:

List[str]

Raises:

ValueError – If the list is empty, not a list, or contains any invalid broker address.

classmethod validate_security_protocol(v)[source]

Validates the security_protocol field to ensure it uses a supported protocol.

Allowed values are: “SSL”, “PLAINTEXT”, “SASL_SSL”, “SASL_PLAINTEXT”.

Parameters:

  • cls – The class being validated.

  • v (str) – The value of the security_protocol field.

Returns:

The validated security protocol.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If v is not one of the allowed security protocols.

classmethod validate_acks(v)[source]

Validates the acks field to ensure it is one of the allowed acknowledgment modes.

Allowed values are: “all”, “0”, “1”.

Parameters:

  • cls – The class being validated.

  • v (str) – The value of the acks field.

Returns:

The validated acknowledgment mode.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If v is not one of the allowed acknowledgment modes.

classmethod validate_positive_int(v, field)[source]

Validates that integer fields are non-negative.

This validator ensures that retries, batch_size, linger_ms, and buffer_memory are all non-negative integers.

Parameters:

  • cls – The class being validated.

  • v (int) – The value of the field being validated.

  • field – The Pydantic ModelField object representing the field.

Returns:

The validated non-negative integer value.

Return type:

int

Raises:

ValueError – If v is negative.

model_config = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

apps_logging_app.producers.kafka_handler.producer module¶

class apps_logging_app.producers.kafka_handler.producer.KafkaHandlerProducer(config)[source]

Bases: BaseProducer

Kafka producer implementation using kafka-python.

This class provides a concrete implementation of BaseProducer for sending messages to Kafka topics. It handles connection management, message serialization, sending messages, and proper cleanup of Kafka resources. It is registered in the producer registry under the type “kafka_handler” with KafkaHandlerConfig.

Parameters:

config (KafkaHandlerConfig)

__init__(config)[source]

Initializes the producer with a Kafka configuration.

is_connected()[source]

Checks if the producer is connected and at least one broker is reachable.

connect()[source]

Establishes the KafkaProducer instance with the configured brokers.

_send(message)[source]

Sends a Message to the specified Kafka topic.

close()[source]

Flushes messages and closes the Kafka producer.

Return type:

None

producer

The underlying Kafka producer instance.

Type:

KafkaProducer

config

Configuration instance for this producer.

Type:

KafkaHandlerConfig

logger

Logger inherited from BaseProducer for logging events.

Type:

logging.Logger

is_connected()[source]

Checks whether the Kafka producer is connected and at least one broker is reachable.

Returns:

True if the producer is initialized and a broker is reachable, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Behavior:

  • Returns False if the producer attribute does not exist or is None.

  • Calls bootstrap_connected() on the KafkaProducer instance to check connectivity.

  • Logs a warning if an exception occurs during the connection check.

connect()[source]

Establishes the Kafka producer connection using the provided configuration.

Creates a KafkaProducer instance with the brokers specified in the KafkaHandlerConfig and sets up JSON serialization for message values.

Behavior:

  • Assigns the KafkaProducer instance to self.producer.

  • Does not start sending messages until the producer is initialized.

Raises:

Exception – Propagates any exception raised during the creation of the KafkaProducer. A critical log entry is recorded before re-raising the exception.

close()[source]

Flushes pending messages and closes the Kafka producer.

Ensures that all messages in the producer’s buffer are sent to Kafka before closing the connection to release resources.

Behavior:

  • Calls flush() on the KafkaProducer to send any buffered messages.

  • Calls close() on the KafkaProducer to terminate the connection.

Raises:

Exception – Any exceptions raised by flush() or close() are propagated.

Return type:

None

type = 'kafka_handler'
